title: Reminiscences
author: Carlyle, Thomas
snippet: Orr, as already said, used to come much about Brownknowe, being  habitually itinerant, and (though schoolmaster of Hoddam) without settled home.

title: Reminiscences
author: Carlyle, Thomas
snippet: One Macleod, Sandy Macleod, a wandering pensioner invalided out of some Highland regiment (who had served in America, I must think with General Wolfe), had strayed to Brownknowe with his old wife and taken a cottage of my grandfather.

title: Reminiscences
author: Carlyle, Thomas
snippet: He worked as carpenter, I know not how long, about Middlebie  ; then laid aside that craft (except as a side business, for he always had tools which I myself have assisted him in grinding) aud went to Brownknowe to farm.

title: Reminiscences
author: Carlyle, Thomas
snippet: He was born, I think, in the year 1757, at a place called Brownknowe,  a small farm not far from Burns wark Hill, in Annandale.
